1267534339455287296.text: 5. The more specific we can make demands for criminal justice and police reform, the harder it will be for elected officials to just offer lip service to the cause and then fall back into business as usual once protests have gone away.

1267534338469568512.text: 4. So if we want to bring about real change, the choice isn’t between protest and politics––we have to do both. We have to mobilize to raise awareness, and we have to organize and cast our ballots to make sure that we elect candidates who will act on reform.

1267534337442033668.text: 3. To do that, we have to know which levels of government have the biggest impact. Changing the federal government is important. But the elected officials who matter most in reforming police departments and the criminal justice system work at the state and local levels.

1267534336410124296.text: 2. The point of protest is to raise public awareness, to put a spotlight on injustice, and to make the powers that be uncomfortable. But eventually, we have to translate those aspirations into specific laws and institutional practices.

1267534335340666895.text: 1. The protests represent a genuine and legitimate frustration over a decades-long failure to reform police practices and the broader criminal justice system. 1059517324053622785.text: When you vote, you have the power to protect voting rights. To make sure our criminal justice system treats everyone equally under the law. To strengthen laws that protect women in the workplace from harassment – and make sure they’re paid equally.

1059517321524535296.text: When we've been at such crossroads before, Americans have made the right choice. Not because we sat back and waited for history to happen -- but because we marched, and mobilized, and voted. We made history happen.

687109831237345281.text: "I believe in change because I believe in you." —President Obama #SOTU

687109072349298688.text: "I can promise that a year from now, when I no longer hold this office, I’ll be right there with you as a citizen." —President Obama #SOTU

687108544823345153.text: "Our collective future depends on your willingness to uphold your obligations as a citizen." —President Obama #SOTU

687108013849624576.text: "Democracy breaks down when the average person feels their voice doesn’t matter." —President Obama #SOTU

687107713227083777.text: "Our public life withers when only the most extreme voices get all the attention." —President Obama #SOTU

687107588022902784.text: "Democracy grinds to a halt without a willingness to compromise." —President Obama #SOTU

687107391817564161.text: "Democracy does require basic bonds of trust between its citizens." —President Obama #SOTU

687107101663993856.text: "The future we want ... is within our reach. But it will only happen if we work together." —President Obama #SOTU

687106894113050625.text: "We need to reject any politics that targets people because of race or religion." —President Obama #SOTU

687105424437280768.text: President Obama: The Trans-Pacific Partnership will protect workers and the environment. #LeadOnTrade #SOTU

687103528557359104.text: "Our troops are the finest fighting force in the history of the world." —President Obama #SOTU

687103411574030337.text: "The United States of America is the most powerful nation on Earth. Period." —President Obama #SOTU

687103265205432320.text: "We’ve got to accelerate the transition away from old, dirtier energy sources." —President Obama #SOTU

687103126248161281.text: "Gas under two bucks a gallon ain’t bad, either." —President Obama #SOTU

687102848190943232.text: "Seven years ago, we made the single biggest investment in clean energy in our history." —President Obama #SOTU

628974226364469248.text: "It is surely the pursuit of peace that is most needed in this world so full of strife." —President Obama #IranDeal

628973664990433280.text: "As members of Congress reflect on their pending decision, I urge them to set aside political considerations.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628973286060265472.text: "As Americans, we should be proud of this achievement." —President Obama #IranDeal

628972950624956416.text: "Now we have before us a solution that prevents Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon without resorting to war." —President Obama #IranDeal

628972310561558528.text: "President Kennedy warned Americans not to see conflict as inevitable. It is time to apply such wisdom.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628971985045819392.text: "I have repeatedly challenged anyone opposed to this deal to put forward a better, plausible alternative." —President Obama #IranDeal

628971616651776000.text: "When we carefully examine the arguments against this deal, none of them stand up to scrutiny.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628971143148408832.text: "If Iran violates this deal, we will have ample opportunity to respond." —President Obama #IranDeal

628970659041816577.text: "Worry less about being labeled weak. Worry more about getting it right.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628970265125371904.text: "How can we in good conscience justify war before we have tested a diplomatic agreement that achieves our objectives?" —President Obama

628969912879321088.text: “The choice we face is ultimately between diplomacy or some sort of war.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628969424855302148.text: “Walk away from this agreement and you will get a better deal—for Iran.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628969117295378432.text: “Those who say we can walk away from this deal and maintain sanctions are selling a fantasy.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628968867461595136.text: "We will continue to have sanctions in place on Iran's support for terrorism and violation of human rights."—President Obama #IranDeal

628968584174153729.text: “There is no scenario where sanctions relief turns Iran into the region's dominate power.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628968283492880384.text: “An argument against sanctions relief is effectively an argument against any diplomatic solution.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628967974863396864.text: "Without this deal, the scenarios that critics warn about happening in 15 years could happen six months from now." —President Obama

628967646831116288.text: "The bottom line is, if Iran cheats, we can catch them—and we will." —President Obama #IranDeal

628967276759244800.text: “This deal is not just the best choice among alternatives—this is the strongest non-proliferation agreement ever.” —President Obama

628966871753060353.text: “If Iran violates the agreement over the next decade all of the sanctions can snap back in to place.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628966441530732544.text: "Iran has powerful incentives to keep its commitments." —President Obama #IranDeal

628966157706354688.text: "This deal shuts off the type of covert program Iran has pursued in the past.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628965547690954752.text: "In July, we reached a comprehensive plan of action that meets our objectives." —President Obama #IranDeal

628965253821272065.text: "What was once proclaimed as a historic mistake is now held up as a success." —President Obama #IranDeal

628965006747394048.text: “The progress of Iran's nuclear program was halted for the first time in a decade.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628964259192397824.text: "It was diplomacy that ratcheted up the pressure on Iran." —President Obama #IranDeal

628963844602224640.text: "Winning this global buy-in was not easy. I know. I was there." —President Obama #IranDeal

628963578901495809.text: "What made our new approach more effective was our ability to draw upon new U.N. Security Council resolutions." —President Obama #IranDeal

628963310289817604.text: “It was our very willingness to negotiate that helped America rally the world to our cause.” —President Obama #IranDeal

628962845342896128.text: "I have also made clear my preference for a peaceful diplomatic resolution of the issue." —President Obama #IranDeal

628962403221311489.text: "Even before taking office, I made clear that Iran would not be allowed to acquire a nuclear weapon on my watch." —President Obama #IranDeal

628962092238802945.text: "The question then is not whether to prevent Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon, but how." —President Obama #IranDeal

628961805964972032.text: "Now more than ever, we need clear thinking in our foreign policy." —President Obama #IranDeal

628961286278123521.text: “More than a decade later, we still live with the consequences of the decision to invade Iraq.” —President Obama #IranDeal

621078447293628416.text: "If we keep taking steps toward a more perfect union ... America will move forward. There's nothing we can't do." —President Obama

621078057705549824.text: "We cannot ignore the problems that we have, but we can't stop running the race." —President Obama

621077765018619904.text: "We are not perfect, but we have the capacity to be more perfect—mile after mile, step after step." —President Obama

621077540937990144.text: "Justice and redemption go hand in hand." —President Obama

621077311509532673.text: "Justice is living up to the common creed that I am my brother's keeper and I am my sister's keeper." —President Obama

621077025827090434.text: "Justice is making sure that every young person knows that they are special and their lives matter." —President Obama

621076671349702656.text: "Justice is not only the absence of oppression—it is the presence of opportunity." —President Obama

621076066937901056.text: "Let's reward prisoners with reduced sentences if they complete programs that make them less likely to repeat an offense." —President Obama

621075828391088128.text: "I've asked my Attorney General to start a review of the overuse of solitary confinement in our federal prisons." —President Obama

621075529370710016.text: "We should not tolerate conditions in prison that have no place in any civilized country." —President Obama

621075206434484224.text: "On Thursday, I will be the first sitting president to visit a federal prison." —President Obama

621074854884737024.text: "We should pass a sentencing reform bill through congress this year." —President Obama

621074570049536000.text: "For nonviolent drug crimes, we need to lower long mandatory minimum sentences—or get rid of them entirely." —President Obama

621073695751041024.text: "Don't just tag them as future criminals. Reach out to them as future citizens." —President Obama

621073361636978688.text: "We have to restore trust between our police and some of the communities where they serve." —President Obama

621073128194637824.text: "We gotta make sure boys and girls in those communities are loved and cherished and nurtured and invested in." —President Obama

621072852284870656.text: "What doesn't make sense is treating entire neighborhoods as danger zones." —President Obama

621072623741460485.text: "We recognize that every child deserves opportunity. Not just some. Not just our own." —President Obama

621072387061067777.text: "One study found that for every dollar we invest in Pre-K, we save at least twice that in reduced crime." —President Obama

621072112178999296.text: "If we make investments early in our children, we will reduce the need to incarcerate those kids." —President Obama

621071772880760832.text: "I believe crime is like any other epidemic—we need to stop it before it starts." —President Obama

621071460916817920.text: "For the first time in 40 years, America's crime rate and incarceration rate went down at the same time." —President Obama

621071166862594048.text: "This is a cause that is bringing people in both houses of Congress together." —President Obama

621070910590615552.text: "Mass incarceration makes our country worse off—and we need to do something about it." —President Obama

621070637927301121.text: "Our criminal justice system isn't as smart as it should be." —President Obama

621070369047187457.text: "Our nation is being robbed of men and women who could be workers and taxpayers." —President Obama

621069908227416064.text: "Around one million fathers are behind bars. Around one in nine African-American kids has a parent in prison." —President Obama

621069124043550720.text: "African Americans are more likely to be arrested. They are more likely to be sentenced to more time for the same crime." —President Obama

621068780286836741.text: "A growing body of research shows that people of color are more likely to be frisked, stopped, questioned, detained." —President Obama

621068484512870400.text: "African Americans and Latinos make up 30 percent of our population. They make up 60 percent of our inmates." —President Obama

621068243990503424.text: "Roughly one-third of the Justice Department's budget now goes toward incarceration." —President Obama

621067861897777152.text: "For $80 billion we could double the salary of every high school teacher in America." —President Obama

621067727067676672.text: "Every year, we spend $80 billion to keep those folks incarcerated." —President Obama

621067509328801792.text: "In far too many cases the punishment does not fit the crime." —President Obama

621067316889960448.text: "Over the last few decades, we've locked up more and more nonviolent drug offenders for longer than ever before." —President Obama

621066895328841728.text: "If we're going to deal with this problem, and the inequities involved, we're going to have to speak honestly." —President Obama

621066657000067072.text: "Our prison population has doubled in the last two decades alone." —President Obama

621066381266542592.text: "In 1980, there were 500,000 people behind bars in America ... Today, there are 2.2 million." —President Obama

621066084616028160.text: "The United States is home to 5 percent of the world's population, but 25 percent of the world's prisoners." —President Obama

621065004716941313.text: "In too many cases our criminal justice system becomes a pipeline from underfunded schools to overcrowded jails." —President Obama

621064684246970368.text: "There is a long history of inequity in the criminal justice system in America." —President Obama

621064425462575104.text: "We can't be satisfied—are not satisfied—until the opportunity gap is closed for everybody in America." —President Obama #NAACP106

621062874534797312.text: "Health care is not a privilege for the few, but a right for all of us." —President Obama

621062534225723392.text: "We made progress, but our work is not done." —President Obama #NAACP106

621062060785299456.text: "I would not be here and so many others would not be here without the NAACP." —President Obama

621061331219709952.text: "Let's get something out of the way up front: I am not singing today." —President Obama

574313308028801024.text: "We honor those who walked so we could run. We must run so our children soar." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

574312751742513152.text: "What a glorious task we are given, to continually try to improve this great nation of ours." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

574312262254608384.text: "We respect the past, but we don’t pine for the past. We don’t fear the future." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

574311631833993217.text: "We know America is what we make of it." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

574311117637427200.text: "We can make sure every person willing to work has the dignity of a job, and a fair wage, and a real voice." —President Obama #Selma50

574310835759280129.text: "With effort, we can roll back poverty and the roadblocks to opportunity." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

574308899072966657.text: "Young people can draw strength from this place, where the powerless could change the world’s greatest power." —President Obama #Selma50

574307375521333248.text: "What could be more American than what happened in this place?" —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

574306819004305409.text: "They proved that nonviolent change is possible. That love and hope can conquer hate." —President Obama #Selma50

574306074041401344.text: "It was not a clash of armies, but a clash of wills; a contest to determine the true meaning of America." —President Obama #Selma50

557738590818795520.text: "Let’s begin this new chapter—together—and let’s start the work right now." —President Obama #SOTU #AmericaLeads

557738133086040064.text: "My fellow Americans, we too are a strong, tight-knit family. We, too, have made it through some hard times." —President Obama #SOTU

557737410059321346.text: "I want future generations to know that we are a people that see our differences as a great gift." —President Obama #SOTU

557737056580149248.text: "If you share the broad vision I outlined tonight, join me in the work at hand." —President Obama #SOTU #AmericaLeads

557736509412241408.text: "It’s possible to shape a law that upholds our tradition as a nation of laws and a nation of immigrants." —President Obama #SOTU

557736161675075584.text: "I’ve seen something like gay marriage go from a wedge issue used to drive us apart to a story of freedom." —President Obama #SOTU

557735552695693316.text: "I know the good, and optimistic, and big-hearted generosity of the American people." — President Obama #SOTU

557735361280237568.text: "I still believe we are one people. I still believe that together, we can do great things, even when the odds are long." —President Obama

557735065887993857.text: "I know how tempting such cynicism may be. But I still think the cynics are wrong." —President Obama #SOTU

557734596574715904.text: "Leading — always — with the example of our values. That’s what makes us exceptional. That’s what keeps us strong." — President Obama #SOTU

557733774478548992.text: "I will not let this Congress endanger the health of our children by turning back our efforts." —President Obama #SOTU #ActOnClimate

557733463189897221.text: "14 of the 15 warmest years on record have all fallen in the first 15 years of this century." —President Obama #SOTU #ActOnClimate

557733214576705536.text: "No challenge poses a greater threat to future generations than climate change." —President Obama #SOTU #ActOnClimate

557732739508871169.text: The science is clear: We have to #ActOnClimate. #SOTU http://t.co/G0cTqYub9q

557731826673139712.text: "When what you're doing hasn't worked for 50 years, it's time to try something new." —President Obama #SOTU

557730795214094336.text: "We need a tax code that truly helps working Americans trying to get a leg up in the new economy." —President Obama #SOTU

557730573427671042.text: "When it comes to issues like infrastructure and basic research, I know there’s bipartisan support in this chamber." —President Obama #SOTU

1250243450085277697.text: The truth is a weak person, a poor leader, takes no responsibility. A weak person blames others.

1250243449128976386.text: The truth is because of an incompetent reaction to this health crisis, the strong economy handed to Donald Trump is now a disaster, causing the suffering of countless Americans and endangering lives.

1250243448151703555.text: The truth is that we did not have proper testing available in March despite Trump repeatedly claiming that we did; and even now, we do not have adequate tests, masks, PPE, and necessary equipment, which creates unnecessary death and suffering.

1238603636688801792.text: As the Senate works to pass #FamiliesFirst, the House will begin work on a third emergency response package to protect the health, economic security and well-being of the American people.

1238603635619225600.text: For families’ health security, #FamiliesFirst increases federal funds for Medicaid to support our local, state, tribal and territorial governments and health systems, so that they have the resources necessary to combat this crisis.

1238603634587426823.text: For families’ food security, #FamiliesFirst strengthens nutrition security initiatives such as SNAP, student meals, seniors’ nutrition & food banks. 22 million children rely on free or reduced-price school meals for their food security; we must ensure that they have food to eat.

1238603633714921473.text: For families’ economic security, #FamiliesFirst secures paid emergency leave with two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of paid family and medical leave. We have also secured enhanced Unemployment insurance for those who lose their jobs.

1238603632716767232.text: #FamiliesFirst is about testing, testing, testing. To stop the spread of the virus, we have secured free #coronavirus testing for everyone who needs a test, including the uninsured.

1238603631487787012.text: Today, we will pass the Families First Coronavirus Response Act after reaching an agreement with the Administration. The United States of America.

Now that the campaign is over—what is the people’s will? What is our mandate?

I believe it is this: Americans have called on us to marshal the forces of decency and the forces of fairness. To marshal the forces of science and the forces of hope in the great battles of our time.

1325254964415881216.text: We cannot repair the economy, restore our vitality, or relish life’s most precious moments — hugging a grandchild, birthdays, weddings, graduations, all the moments that matter most to us — until we get this virus under control.

1325254461049073664.text:
The Bible tells us that to everything there is a season — a time to build, a time to reap, a time to sow. And a time to heal.

This is the time to heal in America.

1325254209613123584.text:
It’s time to put away the harsh rhetoric.

To lower the temperature.

To see each other again.

To listen to each other again.

1325253706061926401.text: To all those who volunteered, worked the polls in the middle of this pandemic, local election officials — you deserve a special thanks from this nation.
